text.section:
A midlevel health care practitioner may be qualified by:
Being a health professional licensed or certified by a body granted such authority by the Kentucky Revised Statutes and passing the qualifying examination; or
Working under the supervision of a family physician in a network for a minimum of five (5) years and passing the qualifying examination.

To maintain a certification in good standing, a midlevel health care practitioner shall:
Complete annually a minimum of ten (10) medical education hours recognized by the board; and
Retake and pass the qualifying examination at least once every five (5) years.
Midlevel health care practitioners shall be utilized to expand the availability of health services. They shall not be used to expand the economic base of any network.

law.history: Amended 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 146, sec. 105, effective July 12, 2012. -- Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 482, sec. 6, effective July 13, 1990.
